De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	 "On the Cauterization of Gout and Joint Pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	 "When joint pains are caused by cold humors that infiltrate each member of the body, and when pain occurs in the feet, it is customary for doctors to call this gout specifically.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	 "And therefore when gout caused by cold is treated and the pain does not subside, then apply a cautery.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	 And it is that you cauterize that appropriate evacuation around the joint of the foot with small cauteries.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	 And it should be an olive-shaped cautery, which looks like this:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	 And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	 And if the pains rise into the teeth or other joints, and this happens many times, then cauterize that (pain) on each tooth with three or four cauteries all around with this olive-shaped cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	 And if the small cauteries that you need are not available, then cauterize with these and do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery beforehand; only as much as needed to touch the surface of the skin.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	 And if the pain rises into the tooth and the back, then administer the cautery which we mentioned in its chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	 And if the pain is only in the hands, and it is called suagra, then prick in the circle of the fingertips like this: prick in these two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	 And if there remains pain in the said places, then prick around the fingertips on each finger and at the tip of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	 And if the pains increase over several days in the shoulders or muscles, then cauterize each of them throughout all parts of the aid.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	 And you do not expel the patient from good care and the reception of medicines, for if good care is taken and heat is expelled with this cautery, he will be cured, God helping.
Capitol .xlv.	 Chapter 45
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	 Of the Cauterization of Ruptures
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	 When a rupture occurs in the groin and the intestines protrude through the hernia, and this begins to happen, it is necessary for you to instruct the patient to stop eating on that day and use lenitive agents so that the opening of his belly does not increase.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	 And then follow the patient between your hands over his back, and command him to hold his breath until it is passed or the hernia or the intestines appear.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	 And then return to him with these words and signs, trying to reduce the hernia over the pubic bone, signaling the edge of which resembles half a circle at the upper parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	 And then heat the cautery whose form is this:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	 "Until it is red and sparks are emitted.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	 Here's a translation of the given text into English:
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	 Here's the translation for the given sentence:
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	 And then press the cautery against that mark with your hand, keeping the cautery straight, and drive it in until you reach the bones of the phalanx into the middle of the duodenum; and repeat with that again if you did not achieve it in the first attempt to enter the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	 And observe carefully the position of the intestine during your cautery, to avoid burning it, lest the patient suffer death or other serious illness.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	 And know that when you do not touch the bones with the cautery, your operation will be ineffective.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	 And it is necessary for the cautery of children to be delicate according to their age and size.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	 Then care for the cauterized area for three days with bandages until the scab from the fire is removed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	 And then care for that area with other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	 And the patient should lie on their back for forty days until the area and the wound are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	 And it is necessary to provide the patient's nutrition according to the duration of their treatment, which fills their stomach and prevents the intestine from coming out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	 And then when it is time to lift after approximately forty days, administer a gentle ointment and keep it there for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	 And let him refrain from work and from overindulgence in food and drink, as well as from loud voices, for when he follows this complete healing regimen, he will surely be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	 And I will describe the treatment for ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and at the beginning, if you wish to prevent them from recurring, cauterize the rupture with a rounded cautery according to its size, so that it is burned out just like the third part of it; and then treat it as we have said, and it will not reoccur.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	 And some say that the rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery like this, because it is marked with a cross.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	 And a line is drawn that runs along the latitude of the back above the rupture, and another line above it; and place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	 Chapter .xlvi.  (or Chapter 46)
De cauterizacio de torcio.	 On the Cauterization of Hernia.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	 When pain occurs in certain members due to a fall or blow and this pain persists for a long time without improving with medicine, then you should cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	 And the size of the cautery should be appropriate for each member according to its magnitude and smallness, as well as its virtue, openness, and the location of the pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	 Therefore, if it is healed by the first cautery, good; and if not, then repeat the cautery on that spot; for it is customary for those pains to be transferred from one member to another nearby, so you must achieve this with the cautery until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	 Chapter 47
De cauterizacio de lepra.	 On the Cauterization of Leprosy
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	 Some lepers are cured with a cautery to great benefit, especially if the type of leprosy is caused by the putrefaction of phlegm and black bile.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	 Therefore, when you want to cauterize that [type of leprosy], consider if the leprosy is common and of that kind which we have said in the division, and do not say this one or that one, and fear for the patient that the corruption may affect his entire body and all its parts. In such a case, you should cauterize him on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and the second below it, even to the forehead at the hairline; and both on two temples; and one behind, either on the nape or the crown of the head.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	 And finally, use the cautery with your hand to make a slight indentation on the bone, thereby relieving the pressure of the accumulated humors, allowing for the release of large vapors from the body; and cauterize over the spleen as needed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	 And if leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears clearly, then you should cauterize with those cauteries that we mentioned on the head; and cauterize at the tip of the nose, and with two cauteries on both cheeks, and with two cauteries on the two vertebrae of the neck, and with six cauteries on the two vertebrae of the back, and with one large one on the vertebrae near the ribs, and one on the ribs, and with two on the ankles, and one on each ankle, and with two on the wrists, and one on each wrist, and with two on the elbows, and two on the armpits, and two on the soles of the feet; and cauterize over all the joints of the fingers of the hands and the feet, and over each heel of the feet, and over the knuckles of the fingers.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	 And be careful not to burn the nerves that are on the heel.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	 And sometimes it is cauterized with a cautery on the bone of the penis and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the anus.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	 And know that the more precisely you apply cauteries, the more beneficial and effective they are; and know that the patient does not feel pain from the cautery itself, as long as their body is already numbed.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	 And it is appropriate that the cauteries be large or small depending on the members and the joints, according to what has been prescribed by the types of tools.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	 And then treat the cautery with flour mixed with honey and with the other treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	 Chapter .48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	 On the Cauterization of Stupor (or Coma).
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	 When a certain member is numb or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and it does not heal, then you should cauterize that numb member with cauteries according to the size of the member, whether it is large or small.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	 And let your cautery enter a little into the spine.  (In this context, "spine" likely refers to the spinal cord rather than the vertebrae.)
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	 And then treat that area with ointment until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	 E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	 But do not assume this [procedure] unless one is knowledgeable in the anatomy of the limbs and the exit points of the nerves that move throughout the body.
Capitol .xlix.	 Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	 On Cauterization of Varicose Veins
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	 When varicose veins are old and you do not administer any of the medicinal ointments to them, then cauterize it with a cautery for a little while, according to the size of the vein's cord until its whiteness and color are removed, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	 Then care for it with a poultice of barley flour and lentils mixed with rose oil and rue leaves, and with the blood of a dove or pigeon, each being one part, and all mixed together. Then a cloth should be soaked in this mixture and placed on the area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	 Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	 On Cauterization of Cancer
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	 When cancer begins and you wish to remove it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around its circumference as it extends.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	 And the wise have said that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle of the lesion; but I have not seen this, because I fear it will cause an ulcer, and I have seen this happen sometimes.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	 And it is more appropriate that the patient be cauterized around the affected area with a circle as we have said, or with multiple cauteries.
Capitol .li.	 Chapter 1
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	 Of the Cautery for the Weakened (or Infirm).
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	 When someone is delayed in their healing process, whether due to the excess of the remedy used on them, or because of the patient's condition being old and weak, with little blood, or due to the time, and you wish to hasten the healing of this person; then cauterize around the affected area with multiple small cauteries; and thus leave it so that it may hasten in its healing.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	 However, if you wish to pierce the area with a cautery, then heat the cautery whose form is this: and place it in the middle of the affected area until it penetrates deeply.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	 And if you place the cautery in that lower part of the arm, so that the body of the arm is relieved; then care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	 Chapter 2
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	 Of the Cautery for Corrosive Ulcers (or Erosion).
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	 A corrosive ulcer is a corruption that moves through the member, which eats away at it like fire consuming dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	 When you see that area being eroded due to the application of a hot cautery iron, then heat the cautery iron with very few and large nails, according to what is appropriate for that area being eroded.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	 Then cauterize the entire affected area until you have completely eliminated all the corrosion and left no trace of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	 Then leave it for three days, and place over the cauterized areas linen cloth soaked in oil until all the scabs have fallen off and all the corruption has been eliminated.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	 Then treat it with a flesh-generating ointment.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	 But if after three days you see that healthy flesh is growing in the area where there was no corruption, then it is good; however, if not, then repeat the cautery on the areas where there is still corruption.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	 And erosion can be treated sometimes with sharp medicine, because that works in place of a cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	 However, cauterization by fire is more effective against pus.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	 And I have already described the treatment with sharp medicine in the appropriate section, so take that when you need to use it.
Capitol .liii.	 Chapter 53
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	 "About the cauterization of wounds and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	 "Many times it is necessary to apply heat to the wound beneath the afflicted foot known as a sore or ulcer, which is large and deep; this wound affects the foot. Cauterization in these cases can be done in two ways: by fire and by hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	 "However, cauterization by fire involves heating the cautery like a vulture's beak, which should be made of iron according to the size of the entire wound from all sides, and should be of fine edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	 "Then place that heated instrument on the wound and turn your hand with the cautery around the edge of the wound until it reaches the depth of the wound.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	 "And leave it there for three days until it begins to form a scab.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	 "And then apply a plaster made of crushed wild mallows mixed with salt on it, and leave the plaster on for one night, because that will heal it from its root.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	 "And then treat the area with flesh-generating ointment until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	 "And if it does not heal, and often this occurs on the surface of the body, mainly in the hands and feet, then you should apply cauterization with hot water to those areas. This involves taking a small tube made of bronze, iron, or vulture's beak and placing it on the wound; then pour a little hot water into the tube, hold your hand steady, and rotate the tube with pressure from your hand all around, pressing the edge of the tube against the root of the wound, so that the hot water reaches the core of the wound. Wait for the patient to feel the burn of the hot water for an hour, then remove it, as the wound with its roots will be healed.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	 And thus it is done with these, and then another enters who will come over all of them that are in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	 And then cure those as soon as the causes of the nails have been eradicated with ointments that generate new skin.
Capitol .liiii.	 Chapter .43.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	 On Cautery for Tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	 When someone has a tremor due to cold in the nerves or due to a fever of similar cause, then you should cauterize them with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of the back, one cautery between each vertebra; and with a cautery on their feet, and on their stomach, with an olive-shaped cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	 And their tremor will subside and the healing of the cold disease will hasten.
Capitol .lv.	 Chapter .55.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	 On Cautery for Sudden Accidents in the Body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	 When there are sudden breakouts on the body, and they are pustules or splits made of thick, corrupt matter; then at the beginning of their appearance, it is necessary that they be cauterized all over the head of the fistula with a subtle cautery with a myrtle handle, the end of which is extended with fire; or with long, thin razors; or with lens-shaped cauteries. ️
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	 Certainly! Let's translate this line by line:
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	 "However, it is necessary that this be done after an evacuation with phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	 In the case of pain in the joints caused by cold humors, which infiltrate each part of the body, and when pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors. And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery. Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out. You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands. De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	 "On the cauterization of blood flow caused by an arrow wound.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	 "When a wound from an arrow is seen to be bleeding due to the cut of the wound itself, or because of the beginning of abscesses or cauterization of the limb, and it appears similar, and it is difficult for that to remain.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	 "Therefore, when this happens to someone, you should immediately press with your hand on the opening of the arrow wound, and place your finger firmly over it until the bleeding stops, without allowing any blood to escape.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	 "And then place the olivewood cauteries, both small and large, in the fire, in sufficient quantity, and blow on them until they are red hot.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	 And immediately take one of the small or large needles according to the location and wound where the artery has been cut, quickly apply pressure to that vein after you have removed the tourniquet, and continue cauterizing until the blood flow is stopped and restricted.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	 And if blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you remove the tourniquet and pull out the cautery, then immediately take another hot cautery from those prepared in the fire, and continue doing this until the bleeding is stopped.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	 And be careful not to burn the nerves that are here, lest another illness come upon the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	 And know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to stop the bleeding in those cases except by one of four methods: either by cauterization as we have said, or by extraction if it has not yet been extracted, because when it is extracted the limbs are better burned and the blood flow is stopped; or it may be tied with thread or a ligature with strong tension, or medicines that have the property of stopping blood flow may be placed on it; and they should be strengthened with a cushion with proper pressure.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	 "But he who administers restriction should do so with discretion and with constraint using cloth or by position due to causes of burning and similar symptoms, do not perform this [procedure] until late.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	 "But if this needs to be done for someone and neither the physician nor any medicine is present, then apply the aforementioned dressing over the openings of that vein as we have said, understanding that great pressure must be applied to stop the blood from the main source of the wound, and do not remove the dressing; and over the dressing, pour very cold water until the blood is congealed and thickened; and beware that one may need a cautery or necessary medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	 "The second section begins.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	 "Of incisions, perforations, and bloodletting, and of phlebotomy, and of wounds, and their similar conditions.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	 "These are the words of Al-Zahrawi (Abulcasis).
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	 "We have already said in the first chapter about every ailment in which it is suitable to use a hot iron or burning medicine, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for this, with the shapes of the cauteries; and I have arranged the chapters from the top of the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	 E io procederò in questo capitolo nella stessa maniera, affinché il richiedente venga sollevato da ciò, cioè da quanto avrà richiesto.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	 And before I begin this, it is necessary, son, that you learn that in this chapter it is about the same thing as in the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	 And because it is necessary that there be great care in this, for the operation which is very often seen in this chapter, namely evacuation by blood, which is with the blood in which life exists, you must have the aspiration of the vein or incision over the abscess, opening of a fistula, cleansing of the wound, extraction of an arrow, or incision of a stone, and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	 And all these are accompanied by fear, trembling, and even death for the majority.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	 And I warn you not to fall into this situation, for sometimes it happens that you must manage patients with many illnesses in a manner similar to men who are very ill.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	 And some of them will die from their illness, and it is a light thing for him to die, and this because of the severity of what he finds in his illness, and because of the length of his illness, and with the illness there is fear which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	 Here's my attempt at translating the given sentence into English:
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	 And therefore it is not necessary for you to consent in that person who comes to you with this manner; and let your caution be greater than haste and greed; and do not presume any cause over this without appropriate certain knowledge which verifies what you need to do, and to whom a praiseworthy succession occurs.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	 And use in the treatment of all your patients prediction and indication for him to whom health is converted, because on that [patient] is your help towards acquiring fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	 Oh, sons, God grant you his understanding and do not take away your guidance and protection from you, for this is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	 And I have organized this chapter by sections following the previous section on cautery, from the treatment of the head to the feet, so that what you seek and need about this may be made easier for you.
Capitol primier.	 Chapter one.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	 About the treatment of water which is contained in the heads of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	 Know that this illness frequently afflicts infants due to birth and when the nurse tightly binds the infant's head without gentleness.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	 And sometimes it happens for hidden causes which are not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	 Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz;
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	 And I have seen that a child's head was filled with water, and the child's head was always so enlarged that he could not put anything on himself because of the size of his head, and more than the humidity increased until the fire died out.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	 And this humidity is either added between the skin and the bone, or it is accumulated beneath the bone on the hip.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	 Because the operation in this case, where the humidity is between the skin and the bone and the abscess is small, requires that you cut into the middle of the head with an incision in the latitude, and let the length of the incision be two nights until the humidity flows out, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	 And therefore, if the humidity has increased and the abscess is larger, then there are two incisions here according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	 And if the humidity is beneath the bone, the sign of it is that you see all the sutures of the head open on all sides and the water is squeezed out when you press that area with your hand from within, and nothing remains hidden to you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	 It is necessary that you cut into the middle of the head with three incisions according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	 Certainly! Let's translate the provided sentence line by line:
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	 This sentence seems to describe another method of incision in the context of treating an abscess or boil (apostema). Here's a line-by-line translation:
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	 And observe that you do not cut the artery, lest it causes bleeding and the patient dies from that loss of blood along with the evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	 Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	 Of the incision of the arteries that are near the ears, called "hilasseysse".
Capitol segon.	 Chapter Two
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	 When there occurs some catarrh or rheum in the eyes or feet and it is old, and one does not benefit from medication, then the final cure for this is the incision of these two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	 Therefore, when you wish to incise those (arteries), have the patient raise their head and press the area with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then tighten the patient's neck with some cloth; and consider where the vein pulsates; and on each of these places, which are near the ears, press, and they will be hidden in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	 And then make an incision on the artery with a probe, and then incise each one with the spatula that has been cut sharp for the incision, going into the bone, and let it be thus throughout the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	 And if you wish, introduce the spatula below the artery and break it at the incision points above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	 And let the length of the incision be two fingers wide, for when some vein is cut, the blood flows out with a pulsating exit, which jumps outside with frequent jumps.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	 But if the artery is not visible at first glance, then you should measure from the ear the length of three fingers, and then probe with a needle, until it reaches the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	 And the amount of blood that should be drawn is one-sixth of a pint, and it should be done lightly, neither more nor less, all according to the strength of the patient and the fullness of their artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	 And then consider the wound, and if there is any cause of splintering on the bone, cut it open so that a hot abscess does not develop.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	 And then strengthen the wound with bandages and linen cloths, and then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	 Chapter III
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	 On the extraction of temples' arteries.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	 When someone has an old or acute migraine, due to humid and acidic qualities in the temples, or severe and similar pain, and it is not cured by the usual medical treatments, then we have recourse for these ailments to the extraction of the arteries in the temples, or their cauterization, as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	 And the manner of the operation and extraction of these is that the patient shaves the hair on their temples; and consider the apparent arch in the temple, for it is shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden except in a few men due to the intensity of cold.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	 And if it is hidden to you, then let the patient's neck be tightened with some cloth; and immediately heat the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the area with hot water until the arch appears clearly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	 And then take the spoon, which has this shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	 And then you scrape the membrane with that instrument until you reach the arch; and then you pour oil on it and extract it from the upper parts until you have removed it from the membrane and uncovered it from all the tissues that surround it.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	 But if the artery is subtle, then wrap it with the tip of the oncii (a type of hook or probe), and then cut off a piece according to the length of its extremities and their contraction, and there will be no flow of blood, for if not cut, the blood will not rise entirely.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	 And then proceed to evacuate some of the blood, approximately one to three pints.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	 And if the wound is large, then you should bind it in two places with a strong double-layered bandage or with ropes, and do not allow it to become infected before the wound heals, lest there be bleeding.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	 And then incise the superfluous part that is between two ligaments; do this at that time or shortly thereafter.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	 And if you wish, cauterize it with a pointed cautery to the bone with a lancet until its extremities are incised, and this will take the place of that same procedure.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	 And this is a better procedure if the patient has a fever or is suffering from inflammation, for cauterization helps to expel moisture, and thus it is more beneficial in treatment.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	 And it is appropriate to clean the wounds and cover them with clean cloths, and then treat them with dry medicines that promote the growth of flesh and bandages until they are healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	 And if while you are working and another time bleeding occurs from the wound, then you must hasten to stop that blood flow, either with a cautery or by packing the wound tightly, and keep your hand pressed until the bleeding stops.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	 And if no cause of that is present to you, then place your finger on the spot until the blood clots, and rinse the spot with very cold water until the sharpness subsides, and apply a compress as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	 And the easiest way to remove an arrow from the body is to cauterize the vein with this two-pronged cautery. First, feel for both ends of the arrow and place each prong, very hot, until it reaches the bone and cuts the vein in two places, so that what is between the ends of the arrow is lengthened, as they are not completely solidified by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	 And this is how the cautery looks:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	 And let the sharpness of the two prongs be equal.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	 However, if the sharpness of one prong is less than that of two prongs, it is better because if they are both very sharp and close to each other, they may cut the flesh too quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	 Therefore, when there is some thickness in them, the heat of the fire remains in them and the flesh is cut gently.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	 And this method is better for all tasks and easier.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	 And let the space which is between two fingers be equal to the thickness of the said finger.
Capitol quart.	 Chapter four.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	 Of the care for the body from acute and acid tears of the eyes.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	 When the tears are acidic and it affects those veins that are on the top of the head outside, do not apply any medicine for its care. And sometimes the face of the patient is reddened and feels tingling, as if there were ants walking on their forehead, and the eyes of such a person are weakened, moist to the point that their lashes are falling out, and the eyelids are cut by the sharpness of the tears. The ancient physicians used this operation for the care of these cases, and they named this care with the sponge.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	 And you command the patient to shave the hairs that are on their forehead, and then you cut into the forehead three equally spaced slits according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	 And if the length of the slit is two fingers: let one slit be equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the slight movement of the eyelids that are near the tear duct, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	 And beware of the beginning of the arteries that are in two places, and extend your hand from the continuation of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	 And if the space of each incision is three times the size of a thumb's width, adjust it accordingly.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	 And if you have a sponge prepared or very dry cloths with which to absorb the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	 And then insert the spatula with two pointed ends, this is the shape of his incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	 which begins at the temples and extends to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	 Remove all the skin that is between two incisions, and scrape with the scalpel on the bone, then do this from the middle of one incision to the other.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	 And then insert this spatula into the first incision again, and introduce another instrument which is called a lancet, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	 Place the sharp side against the skin next to the skin, and the other side against the bone, and use it to cut until you reach the middle crack, and with it cut all the vessels that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	 It seems that the text is discussing the process of creating or managing an incision. Here's my line-by-line translation:
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	 And since a large quantity of blood is lost, press the places where the blood clots are.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	 And then place in each crack a piece of old cloth, and place over those clumps mixed with wine and oil and vinegar, and ensure that it does not become an infected abscess.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	 And on the third day, remove the bandage and administer a large infusion of hot water or tea, and then treat it with an ointment made of basil, rose oil, and other ingredients until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	 Chapter V
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	 Of the care of tears by catharsis and of the ulcers that descend from the inner parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	 When someone has a severe and persistent catharsis, and the patient's eyes are weakened and shrunken, and their vision is impaired, and the eyelids have ulcers and their hair falls out, and there is sharp pain in the front of the head with consequent protrusion, then know by these symptoms that the humors and catharsis come only from the small veins of the inner parts.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	 And the best treatment for this is as follows: tell the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision in the middle of the forehead, a small one in size (and begin with the incision from the left temple towards the right; and let the incision go into the bone; and keep your hand away from the temples which are good for chewing), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	 "Dry all the blood with a sponge or a dry cloth, and then fill between the two lips of the wound with old cotton or linen rags.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	 "And then cover it tightly with powder mixed in wine and oil, so that an abscess does not form.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	 "And when you release it and see that the abscess has already diminished, then it is necessary to rub the bone within until flesh begins to grow on it, and then treat it with a drying regimen which will make the flesh grow, such as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mix them together, and from them make a plaster and apply it to these wounds for the growth of new flesh.
Capitol .vi.	 "Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	 "On the treatment of that which falls into the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	 "Everything that falls into the ears is of one of four kinds: either it is a mineral stone or something similar to stone, such as iron and glass; or it is from a plant, such as a grain of millet or a bean; or it is a liquid thing, such as water and sour wine and things similar to them; or some small animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	 It seems that the text is discussing a remedy for earaches or similar issues. Here's a line-by-line translation:
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	 And next, place some pieces of cloth or wool in the circumference of the ear, and extend the ear to its original position above, because swollen parts are often healed with these remedies.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	 And if it is not healed, then administer an extraction using the instrument called "subtle gesti epicicarios," which has this form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	 And if it is healed with the instrument, it is good; and if not, then administer an extraction using a thin needle of minimal thickness.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	 And thus, if it is not healed by this method, then make a cannula of iron and insert the tip of the cannula into the hole in the ear, and close around the cannula with wax and softened oil so that only the cannula remains open.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	 And then extract it with your breath using strong suction, for this is often done in the manner we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	 But if it is not healed in this manner, then take some alum or wax with which birds are caught, and place a small amount on the tip of a reed, and then wrap a clean cloth around that reed.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	 And then proceed to insert it in the ear canal gently, and then dry the ear of moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	 And so if not forgotten with all the causes we've mentioned, then cut it before it becomes an abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	 And the way to cut it is that you first bleed the patient from the saphenous vein according to their strength, and then have someone squeeze it between your hands and turn the ear towards its parts, and make a small incision at the back of the ear in a well-pinned place.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	 And let the incision be in the shape of a crescent until it reaches the stone, and when the stone is found, remove it if you can with appropriate instruments; then immediately close the incision at that time, and care for it until it heals.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	 And if the cause of the condition in the ear is one of the growths that grows and swells, then administer treatment and extraction of it; but if it does not obey you at once, then take fine white wax like this:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	 And administer with that the poultice of that herb which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	 And do not do this when you think that it is already moistened by the steam of the ear, and place that in many places, and then remove those with tweezers or with a delicate gesture, or as we have said, because its removal is relieved.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	 But in the case of water that has entered the ear, it is necessary for the patient to sneeze at the beginning with some condition, and fill his ear with some old cloth, and pour over that ear in which there is water, and if by this it is expelled, it is good; and if not, then take some small heated stones according to the length of the finger, and heat them a little in the fire, and the patient should insert one of these into the hole of his ear and jump on one foot from that side and strike with another stone on the stone that is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	 Therefore, do not stop with a stone until all the water is expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	 And when the water has been expelled, take a piece of paper or cloth and insert one end into the ear, and extend the other end with fire until it is burnt to the middle.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	 And then place another bag and do this as many times until all the water has been expelled, and pierce that with a cannula as mentioned above about the stone extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	 However, in the case of a foreign body entering that ear canal, if it is a small object, similarly pierce and extract it as we have mentioned in the section above; but if it is a large object that causes pain within the head, then administer its extraction with tweezers and scissors, and the cause will be lighter than all other causes entering the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	 But in the extraction of a worm generated within the ear, when you treat it with water as we have mentioned in the section and in the treatise on distillations and your treatment does not work, then you should look at the ear towards the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	 And therefore if any cause of the worms appears here, then extract it with tweezers or fine scissors; but if no cause appears, then take a cannula that is narrow at the tip and wider above, which has this shape.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	 And insert the narrow tip into the ear according to the amount that the patient can tolerate; and then suck out strongly with it, and do this many times until all the worms have been expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.
