E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	 And then administer medications that promote the growth of flesh until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	 And Al-Zahrawi says that the summary of this advice which we have given is nothing other than to see that some of these apostemas have already taken the throat of the patient and the patient has come close to death, and his soul has dried up, and some people go to incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe through the wound for some breathing, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	 And for this reason he ordered the wound to be left open until the evil of the illness is consumed; and its evil lasts for three days; and therefore then he commanded that the wound be sewn up, and cared for it until it was healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	 And what I have seen myself is that a servant took a knife and cut her throat with it, severing a part of the lung, and I was called to care for her. When I arrived, I found her as if she were dying, uncovered the wound, and found the blood which was flowing from the wound slowly.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	 Therefore, I concluded that she had not cut a vein or artery, and the wind was coming out of the wound, so I treated her until she healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	 And the servant did not speak hoarsely or in a weak voice, and after a few days she recovered her usual strength.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	 And now I say that in the section of the epileptic [patient] there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	 Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	 On incision of an abscess that occurs in the neck outside, which is called a neck hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	 This abscess named neck hernia is quite large according to the complexion of the body, and it is very common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	 And it occurs in two ways: either it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	 And in the natural case, there is no need to cure [it].
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	 And the accidental (condition) is of two kinds: one resembles large knots, and the other resembles an abscess caused by the obstruction of an artery, which is feared.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	 And it should not be presumed (to treat) in him with iron, except in the case that it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	 And you should pursue that and investigate it with the said (method), and if you find it resembling large knots, and it is not connected to any of the veins, then you should incise it just like the knots, and extract it with water that contains the peel of pear and burdock; but if not, then explore its entire being, and subsequently cure the area with water suitable for healing until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	 Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	 On the cutting of the different types of knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	 There are many types of knots, and I have already mentioned all their types in the division (section).
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	 And it is fitting that I also explain the difference between a knot and an excrescence, so as to avoid confusion.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	 Therefore, I say that with an excrescence there is heat and fever and intense pain until the boiling of the excess fluid subsides; and it is a complete putrefaction, which then ceases the fever, the pain, and the heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	 "However, if there is no heat, fever, or pain, then consider that condition to be the proper one for the lion's cub.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	 "And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a cheese, made in this way: whether it is larger or smaller, they are of two types, because they can be fat and contain moisture, and the colors of the moisture are many, as I have said before in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	 "Therefore, when you arrive at the treatment of this condition, examine it and inquire about its beginning with an instrument called an introme, as will be explained in the following chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	 "And this is the manner of inquiry for all apostemas and nodes: you must take this instrument and insert it into the moistest part of the apostema, and then slowly revolve the said instrument until you know that the instrument has already penetrated the cord.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	 "Then press with your hand according to the size of the apostema, and then remove the instrument and observe what has exited in its wake.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	 "And if the liquid is watery and of any color, then you should incise it with a shallow cut, as I have said for other apostemas.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	 And if there is no moisture from the trace of the entrance, then know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	 And dry on him I dry with the form of a cross according to this shape:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	 As you have been taught, and suspend that one hanging down, and peel the cord from all around with ease, and keep the skin or sack, if possible, on top of it, and draw out that corruption with the knot.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	 But if it breaks during the operation, it is not possible to extract that corruption, and many times it happens this way, and then you extract it by force until nothing remains of it.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	 Because if any part of it remains, little or much, the knot returns according to the most.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	 And if you see that any small part remains, then fill the wound with some sharp and strong corrosive powders and bind the wound, and place on it a cautery to prevent an abscess from forming, and treat it with other remedies until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	 And if the knot is large, then you sew up both lips of it and treat it with a remedy that promotes healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	 But if there is an artery or a vein opposite it, then you cauterize and fill the place with powdered vitriol, leaving that narrow for two days or three until the wound softens and the boiling of the blood subsides; and then return to divide what remains of the knot.

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	 About the section of abscesses that occur due to archery or a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	 When an artery is ruptured and the cord which lies on top of it becomes solidified, then serious boils occur, known as inflammation and abscess. For the signs by which inflammation and abscess are recognized to be either from an artery or a vein: because when the abscess is from an artery, it extends lengthwise along the body; and if you press on the abscess with these words, you feel in it a certain whistling sound.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	 And that which is from a vein appears as a round swelling on the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	 And incision on this abscess is a mistake, especially in those below the armpits, in the groin, in the neck, and in many other parts of the body; and it is very dangerous, so its treatment with iron should be avoided, and that which is at the extremities or on the head must be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	 However, on those caused by the inflammation of the opening of an artery, make a section in the cord along its length; and then widen the section with hooks near the artery, until you have freed it from the tunic so that it is laid bare.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	 And then place on it a needle and make it penetrate to the other side, and ligate the artery with double thread in two places — which I have used for you in the extraction of two arteries that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	 And then puncture the area that is between two ligaments with a lancet until all the blood in it has come out and the abscess has been dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	 And then administer treatment to the area where pus has formed until the ligaments fall; and then treat it with appropriate ointments until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	 And if it is an abscess caused by the drying of a vein, then you must have water within your reach that is as close as possible to the abscess with a cord, and then insert the needle under the area where you had your hand, and make it penetrate; and let there be a double thread in it until you extract that from the other side, and then bind the abscess with a good ligature as I have told you in the ligature of the grape with two parts and two ends of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	 But if you fear that the thread will be pulled out, then insert a needle with wax under all of the abscess until the first incision of the needle, and strengthen your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	 Then dry the abscess in its middle part until when what is inside it has come out, then you incise the superfluity of the cord and let what is connected to it go.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	 And then place on the wound the cloth which you have soaked in wine and oil, and then administer the treatment which is made with clay and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	 Chapter One of the abscess that occurs due to a twist of the nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	 Thus, an abscess can occur in the arteries and veins, and similarly, an abscess can occur in the nerves when there is a blow to them or excessive labor, and by similar means.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	 And it most commonly occurs in the areas of the ankles or soles, or in any place where the joints are weakened.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	 And it is a serious abscess, and its color resembles that of other parts of the body, and in its most severe condition without fever, when it is very narrow, the patient feels something like a stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	 And it is not an abscess that accumulates in the front of the body, and therefore the neck is left out, as it is located in all other parts but does not move forward or backward.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	 Therefore, those that are in the joints should not be filled with iron, because it will easily become contracted.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	 But that which is on the head or forehead should be cauterized without a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	 "But if it is an abscess, then take that with the scissors and incise it carefully.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	 "And if it is large, then suspend that with hooks, and scrape that away, and immediately remove that; and close the wound with stitches, and treat that until it is healed.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	 "About the incision of an abscess which occurs in the chest, which also occurs in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat. E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz. E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	 "And already their lips had turned black and split open, and moisture ran from it constantly.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	 "Therefore I incised those and found in one a scorpion with eighteen stings, and in the other a scorpion with six stings.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	 And the operation in their incision is that you consider whether the patient is moist, and the color of the swelling is white, moist, of subtle nature; then you incise them with a wide spatula, and let there be in your presence cauteries in the fire, because often you must expel much blood from it; and if blood comes out, cauterize that area.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	 And if you see the patient is weak and fearful, beware of incising with iron; but rather take freshly made lead plaster, and strengthen that swelling with it, in the manner we have described; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	 And then tighten the lead wire in the constriction; then do not cease to strengthen the lead greatly on it, until it is cut and falls off by itself without effort.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	 But if it is of great size, then there is some cause for fear and dread in its incision, and especially in those that are in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	 But it is possible that you can incise most of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	 And then care for it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros. Capitol .lii.	 Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	 Of the treatment for inflammation of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	 Inflammation of the navel is caused by several factors: either by fissures in the cipher which is on the belly, and from it comes out the intestine or hernia as happens with other ruptures; or by blood that flows from a vein or artery as previously stated, or by trapped gas within it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	 But if it is due to a fissure in the cipher and protrusion of the intestine, then the color of the abscess is similar to that of the body; and it is soft without pain, and appears in various situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	 And if it is due to the protrusion of the intestine, then its condition with what we have mentioned above is of greater diversity and intensity, and when you press on that area as described, it becomes hidden and returns; and it is very light with it, and the entrance of the bath and intense labor are greatly increased.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	 Based on the pattern and the context of the previous translations, let's attempt to translate this line by line:
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	 And if it is due to blood, then with these signs you should identify the abscess by its darkening color.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	 But if it is due to flesh, then it is a serious, large and hard abscess, and it is fixed according to its quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	 But if it is due to gas, then touching it will be painful.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena. And then carefully extend the pus of the abscess on the bandage and insert your finger into that incision; and if you have found and secured it with the bandage, then extract it quickly and push the intestine back inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	 And if you have found the hernia, then take it with a hook; and cut off its excess parts.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas. E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	 And if you wish, remove the needles and let the place remain open until the spread flesh can fall off by itself; or cut that part when it is thinned out and has fallen off, and then heal it with water from the appropriate ointments until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	 And if the protrusion of the navel is due to flesh or fluid in it, then you should draw out the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or fluid that you find in it, and then heal it with water that promotes healing and strengthens the area.

De curacio de cranc.	 Chapter 53. About the treatment of crabs (lice).
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	 We have said in the division about the species of crabs (lice) and how to treat them with medicines, and that it is necessary to use iron in the treatment so that it does not become ulcerated; we have also mentioned crabs born from mothers and the caution needed for their treatment.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	 And the ancients said that sometimes crabs (lice) are in places where their eradication is possible, such as on the head or in the armpits and similarly in other parts of the body, and it is best to remove them all, especially when they are just starting out small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	 But when they are old and large, it is not wise to approach them, for I have never seen anyone cured of that, nor have I seen or heard of any other who has reached such a state.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	 And the treatment for them is as follows: you should first purge the patient and administer black hellebore several times, and then bleed them if there is a clear indication of congestion.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	 Then prepare the patient with the appropriate preparation for the operation, and then proceed with the incision that is required; then scrape thoroughly from all sides with a good-quality spoon until no cause of its return remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	 And let the blood flow, and do not stop it abruptly, but apply pressure to the area and cleanse the thick blood completely with your hand or with an instrument suitable for this purpose from among those available to you.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	 But if you encounter an obstruction of thick blood in the vein or artery, then cauterize that area until the flow of blood ceases, and then treat it with another treatment until it is healed.

De curacio de ydropici.	 On the Treatment of Diabetics.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	 We have already mentioned in the classification the types of diabetes due to water and the signs of each type, as well as their treatment with medications.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal. E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo. E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh. De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	 Concerning the treatment of infants whose urethral openings are not perforated.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	 Sometimes, one of the infants is born from his mother's womb with an unperforated head of the penis (or it is narrowly perforated and not in its proper place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	 Therefore, it is necessary to cut with a needle as soon as he is born, using a very fine instrument in this manner:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	 And then place a thin lead pin through the opening and tie it there, and keep it for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	 When he wants to urinate, remove it and let him urinate; then replace it afterwards.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	 And if you do not place the lead there, it is possible that the urine which comes to that place will not find an opening.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	 But the one with a narrow opening should be treated with a lead pin as we have said, for several days until it is widened.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga. E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	 And then place a cloth on top of that and press it, so that the remaining water drains out.

But if there is resistance to the draining of water at that time, you should puncture it: and this is not done except for this reason, because the white skin around the opening of the wound resists and prevents the outflow of water. And know that the water will return and may be retained for almost six months or a year; and when it is accumulated, then it should be punctured in the same manner, because the patient will thus spend his days [in this condition].

Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels. Capitol .lxix.	 "Chapter 69.
De castracio.	 "On Castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	 "You should know that castration is forbidden in our law, but it has been related to me, and I remember it in this book; the remembrance of it is necessary only for two reasons: one is so that a doctor may have knowledge of it when questioned about it, so that he may know how to care for those on whom it occurs. The other reason is that we often have need of castrating other animals for our benefit, such as mules, oxen, pigs, and similar beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	 And thus I say that castration is performed in two ways: either by tearing or by cutting with a dry method.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	 But in that which is performed by tearing, the method of the operation is to have the beast cease breathing in hot water until its testicles are softened and lengthened and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	 Then take those with your hand until they are completely resolved and do not appear below the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	 But in castration performed by cutting and dry method, it is necessary that you hold the beast and press its spermatic cord with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	 Then tie the suspensory ligament, and cut over each testicle with one incision until you have processed both testicles.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	 Then cut those parts that you will have skinned.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	 And do not leave any scab on them, except the subtle one which is over the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	 And this method of castration is better which is performed by tearing, for tearing leaves very little scab of the testicles so that the beast desires to mate.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	 Then treat the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	 Chapter 70
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	 Of the treatment for hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	 Hermaphroditism in men occurs in two ways: one is when a figure like that of a woman's pubis appears in the space between the testicles, in which there are hairs.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	 And sometimes urine flows from that place, which is located in the space between the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	 But in women, it is of one kind: and that is when the woman's vulva is like two men's testicles, a little smaller at the outer edge just like the foreskin of a man and with two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	 And the treatment is of three kinds: two for men and one for women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	 And it is necessary that you first remove those attached tissues until the swelling subsides, and then treat them with the remedies for other diseases.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	 And in the second type of men, where there is urine in the space between the testicles, there is no treatment or surgery for him.
Capitol .xxi.	 Chapter 21
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	 Of swelling and prominent flesh due to causes of women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	 Lentigo, which is a common condition related to natural causes, occurs until it becomes excessive and requires treatment; in some cases, it is magnified in certain women to such an extent that it spreads as it does in men and is transmitted during intercourse.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	 Therefore, you must remove the excess of lentigo with your hand or with oil and vinegar.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	 And do not end with vinegar, especially on the face, to prevent blood flow.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	 Then treat it with remedies for skin diseases until it is healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	 However, flesh born is flesh that grows in the uterus of the mother until it fills her (and for this reason some call it "tailed illness"); therefore, we must treat it like we treat lentigo, and care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	 Chapter .72
De curacio de alratica.	 About the treatment of alopecia.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	 Alopecia is when the woman's vagina is not perforated, or the opening is too small.  (Note: The term "alratica" and the description given here do not correspond to the modern understanding of alopecia, which is hair loss.)
E es o natural o accidental.	 And it can be either natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	 Accidental is the illness that has preceded it, and this is caused either by flesh not properly joined or by a subtle or thick splinter.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	 And this occurs either in the womb of the mother, or in the ribs of the child, or in the upper part of the body, or in the lower part. You should prohibit cutting, penetration, and pregnancy, and strongly prohibit menstruation.
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	 The recognition of this is done by the examination of the midwife, if the opening is apparent, immediately; but if it is not apparent, then you should search for it with your fingers or with a ray [of light].
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	 But if the opening is due to a thin splinter and it is close to the two lips, then you cut and remove it.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	 And place over the two lips a powder of rose petals, and immediately after that place your index fingers on both sides together.
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	 And the woman should lie on her back with her hips spread, and then spread the two lips with force until that thin splinter is broken and the opening is opened.
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	 And immediately take wool and dip it in oil and place it on the area, and go with a man for the day so that the torn flesh is not healed.
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	 "But if the tumor is large and thick, then it is necessary for you to cut it with a spatula of lead or with a leaf of myrtle.
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	 "But if the swelling is due to an infection, then suspend it with hooks, and cut it open.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	 "And with you should be the medicines that stop bleeding without cauterization, such as aloes, dragon's blood, and glasswort, mixed with egg white.
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	 "And then administer a wide lead probe so that the wound is not prematurely healed.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	 "And keep it there for several days, and apply lard to it.
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	 "And then treat it with the other healing method until it is healed.
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	 "And sometimes this happens during childbirth, and then you should cut according to this method.
Mays si aysso es per apostema crancos, a l’apostema crancos le qual es en la mayre no sia fayta contrarietat am ferr en deguna manieyra.	 "But if it is due to a hardened abscess, then for the hardened abscess that is in the womb, do not make an incision in any way.

De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	 On the perforation of the eardrum occurring in a woman.

Capitol .lxxv.	 Chapter 75.
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	 To teach the midwives how to treat pregnant women when they are sick according to an unnatural figure.
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	 It is necessary that the midwife knows at the beginning the figure of a natural birth by its signs, and this is when you see the woman pushing from below and she wants to smell the air, and because of this she is relieved from what is above her during childbirth, and hastens the expulsion of the fetus. Then you know that this birth is according to the natural figure, and it is the baby's head emerging first, and the second comes with it, either suspended or hanging from the umbilicus.
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	 When you see those signs, then it is necessary to press the stomach so that the embryo descends gently, because when it comes over its head, they give it the second blow, and it is cleaned of those superfluities with a good cleaning.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu i, o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	 But that which happens in this case is unnatural and not to be praised, because when the embryo has come out of its feet and the body comes out before its head and its feet, and one hand comes out at the foot or at the head, or the head and the hand come out together with the stomach, it is easily turned over on its neck, and it resembles the figures of the unpraiseworthy.
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	 Therefore, it is necessary for the midwife to be wise and subtle in all these matters, and to guard against error and deception.
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	 And I am showing all the figures of these, and what intelligence is in them, so that it may be known by this and may have been established on this.

E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	 And if both hands of the child have already been expelled at the beginning, then it is necessary that you reduce them little by little with gentleness.

And if the hands are not turned inside and the child dies, then cut them off and extract the limbs of the child or tie its body to its hand with a cloth and pull it out equally, because that will be expelled.
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	 "From the excretion of the fetus onto its feet.

Quan le fet eyssira segon aquesta forma, lahoras tu engenies en entrometen las suas mas petit a petit; e aprop la femna stia evessada sobre le sieu col, e les pes de lu pengo en jos, e aquelas sia jasent sobre le lieyt, e complegua las suas mas.	 When the child exits in this manner, then you carefully insert your little finger into its mouth bit by bit; and then the woman should lean over the child's head, and its legs should hang down, and these should rest on a pillow, and hold its hands.
E aprop prem sobre le ventre de lu petit a petit, e aprop extratz aquo que es dejos les pes de lu de las aurelhas entro que sia preparada en la partida pus dejos.	 Then press gently on the child's abdomen, and then extract what is left behind its legs from the ears until it is ready to come out of the lower part.

But when it rots, it raises a very bad smell in the head and in the stomach, which harms the patient; therefore, at that point, it is necessary to administer substances with a pleasant scent and appropriate for this purpose.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	 But some of the ancients have already tried using fumigation with dried grapes and figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	 The method by which a woman is fumigated for the retention of menstruation and the second trimester:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	 It should be made of glass or iron.

De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	 Of the treatment of an infant's unperforated anus.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	 Many infants are born with their anuses not yet pierced, which is a delicate and hidden matter.

E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	 And then place over it some wool soaked in oil and vinegar; and then treat it with an ointment until it is healed.

De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	 Of the treatment of fistulas that occur below.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	 Fistulas that occur in the lower parts, which are thick and large, occurring near the anus or in the space between the buttocks.
E es una fistula o motas.	 And it is either a fistula or hemorrhoids.

And how a penetrating fistula into the anus and non-penetrating is known, is that you put your finger into the anus, and introduce a subtle tent of iron or silver into the fistula when it is not turbid.

E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio. De curacio de las plaguas.	 For the treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	 I have already mentioned in the section on wound treatment what is appropriate for this book, and now I will describe the treatment of wounds using both hands and medicines according to their nature.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	 Therefore, I say that wounds are classified according to how they are made and the location on which they fall.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	 And the reasons why many times wounds are made are such as striking by stone, or cutting with a sword or knife, or piercing with a spear, or a club, or an arrow, or similar to those other causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	 However, the wounds that are in specific locations of the body are such as a wound that falls on the head, or the neck, or the feet, or the belly, or the chest, and similar to those of other members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	 And I am describing the treatment of some wounds so that you may use that reasoning and rule for other wounds as well.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	 And I will begin with the treatment of simple head wounds, because the memory of compound fractures will come at the beginning of the third chapter.  (In medieval medicine, "compound" referred to complex or severe wounds, not just open fractures as it does today.)
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	 "Therefore, I say that when a simple blow to the head occurs and it is not a fracture, consider: if it is due to the impact of a stone or something similar, and if the artery has been cut only slightly but it is a severe wound and you fear the formation of an abscess on the patient, then you should act quickly and perform phlebotomy on the temporal artery immediately; do not delay this. Extract from him as much blood according to his strength, unless there is any other reason that prohibits phlebotomy, especially if the blood coming out of the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	 "And let the phlebotomy be done on the opposite side of the wounded part; and ensure that the patient avoids fullness, overeating, and heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	 "But if any cause prohibits bloodletting, then the patient should be put on a lighter diet and avoid meat and wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	 "And place on the wound, if an abscess forms, cotton dipped in plain oil or wine that has been made astringent.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	 "But if the formation of an abscess is certain, then place on the wound, if it is fresh and has not been exposed to air for too long, a small amount of the powder that I will mention shortly.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	 And if the air has already changed that, then place some ointment over it until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	 But if the wound is large or caused by a blow and appears unnaturally deep, and its lips are not properly aligned, then align them with stitches as I will explain the method of stitching.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	 But if the wound is already exposed bone and there is no retention of it but only a slight suspensory ligament, then incise that area and subsequently treat the wound with medicines and restore the flesh in its place, and instruct the patient to consume foods rich in: heads, fish, and similar items until healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	 And if you find putrefaction in the flesh and it does not adhere to the bone, then cut away all that is putrid and clean it out, and then treat it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	 But if there is an artery or vein in these wounds from which blood may flow and it has not been cut by medicines, then you should look for the artery, and if you find it uncut, then cut it with a spatula, or ligate it; and if what we have said does not suffice, then cauterize until the bleeding is stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	 And if these plagues are simple and small, then their cause is light; so you should sprinkle this powder over them because it will solidify before the air changes them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	 And the manner of making this powder is as follows: take one part olive oil, two parts dragon's blood, and three parts calcined shell; all should be finely ground and sieved, and with it the wound should be filled, and a good bandage applied until it heals well over it.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	 Then strengthen it above with bandages and leave it alone, and do not remove the bandage until it is healed, because the medicine will not be effective unless it is completely healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	 And sometimes this alone acts as a precaution, when you do not have olive oil and dragon's blood at hand.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	 And perform the same operation on large wounds when it is necessary to cover them and keep them closed, and these are fresh wounds with their blood, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	 And if the air has altered them, especially in the summer, then this powder is not intended for that, but rather you should treat them with the water we mentioned earlier, so that you place on them some digestive ointments, or you can place on them a paste of barley flour with water and honey until they develop pus; and then treat them with the other treatment until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	 But if it happens that there is a bone fracture, and it is small, then you should extract it with tweezers.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	 And I say the cure for skull fractures involves something called trephination.
De las plaguas del col.	 Of neck wounds
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	 But if the wound occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in treatment, and it is like a simple head wound.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	 But if the nerves of the neck have been cut or an artery, then if it is a nerve, there is no need for a stitch but rather avoid treatment with something that causes strong astringency, such as zinc and iron (which are similar to them) because they irritate the nerves and contract that part.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	 And do not place any pressure on the wound, because the substance of the nerves is cold and its continuation is with the brain, which is the most important of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	 And if it is treated with light medicines, such as being washed with sweet water, sometimes infused in rose oil or non-rose oil, and cleansed when washed with sweet water and other stones diminishing according to this method, and moist bandages.

Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	 Certainly! Let's break down the sentence and translate it line by line:
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo. De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	 "Of the wounds of the neck or similar, when made between the shoulders and done with a sword, dagger, lance, or similar.

E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	 "And for other wounds that occur in other parts of the body, the treatment is the same as we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	 "Of the wounds of the abdomen.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	 "The condition that occurs in the abdomen is either great, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	 "In the case of a great wound, sometimes the intestine or its nerves are affected because their insertion is more intense and more delicate.

E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	 And the two other sutures are common to other wounds, but nevertheless they are more specific for the suturing of the abdomen.

Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre. E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	 And in some cases, it is beneficial to use an astringent, and it is better for the resolution of inflammation than water alone.

Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	 As for the instrument, consider its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc. E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es. Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos. E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra. E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	 And in this way, you must administer it for both large and small wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	 And for small wounds, make sure that the one who administers it is between your feet, holding the wound completely with his hand and closing the lips of the wound; then discover whether there is any cause to apply another suture.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	 And this is the common method of suturing: first take the needle, or count the number of needles according to the size of the wound; then pass the thread through the end of the wound on the little finger, and tighten the thread, making sure not to put a knot in both ends of the cord. With two ends of the thread, place them under the parts within, until you make that part penetrate from that side; and after adding two ends of the thread and two ends of the needle, you have made four stitches.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	 And then strengthen the double stitch around the edge of the wound, and sometimes both parts together, and then join the two lips of the wound for decent closure; and then lay the thickness of the finger and insert another needle in it, and then tie it with thread as you did with the first needle; and do not stop doing this with needles until you have completed the entire contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	 And let the needles be moderate in size between thickness and fineness, for fine needles slightly cut into the flesh; thick ones are difficult to insert into the skin, and therefore it is necessary that they be moderate in both fineness and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	 And it is not necessary for the needle to be inserted into both ends of the skin too close together, so that the flesh is not slightly cut and the wound does not split before healing.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	 And do not extend the stitches too far, so that the wound is not prevented from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	 And then trim the ends of the needles so that they do not prick the patient while sleeping; and place on the stitches soft pads from all sides, which have the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the wound is healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	 And these kinds of stitches with needles in any manner are more suitable for small wounds, because for the stitching of them only one or two needles or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	 But the second stitch is more common: and it is that you apply the stitches to the four extremities, of the tendon and two extremities of the sinew, at once, with a needle in which there is thread wrapped around in both delicacy and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	 And then when you have penetrated these four extremities with the needle, return the needle from that same part where it began, so that the thread may rise to the higher part of the wound, so that the stitch is like a stitch in cloth which holds the clothes tightly together.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	 And place between each stitch the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	 And this stitch is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	 And with such a stitch I sewed the wound which had happened to a man in his belly, who had been wounded by a sword, and the opening of the wound was more than one palm's width, and it was protruding around two palms of the intestine from the middle part, and the opening was in the middle of the member; and then I returned that after the intestine had been out of the wound for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	 And the wound was healed within fifteen days or thereabouts, and the patient was cared for and recovered; and then he lived for many years after, continuing with his usual habits.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	 And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and it was by miracle, for I did not cure him with an ointment, because it was in a place where no ointment or any medicine was found, but I placed on the wound a clean cloth two times a day and frequent washing with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	 But I will describe two types of proper stitches according to the teaching of the Word.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	 And it is that you begin with the stitch of the cord, and insert the needle from the outside to the inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	 And thus when the needle penetrates the thread and you have made a loop, straighten it along the entire length of the body, leaving the end of the thread which you inserted the needle; and make the needle penetrate again from the inside to the outside in the other extremity of the middle.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	 And thus when you have made that penetration, then you make that same penetration again in the same extremity of the middle from the outside to the inside; and leave the end of the thread which is in this side, and make the needle penetrate in the other extremity from the inside to the outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	 And have it penetrate with that, your penetration with which you make it penetrate in the cavity at the end of the observed part, which is within him, so that all of it enters.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	 And then begin from this side of the cavity, and with that [instrument] penetrate to the other side, and remove the needle from the thread which penetrated, and then reduce it into the same thread and bring the end of the cavity on this side to this end of the observed part; and remove that [thread] from the part nearest him.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	 And do this once and again, and do it one time close to another until you sew everything that is outside according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	 And the summary of this method of suturing is that you sew with a skin stitch with which you sew the skin, so that you sew the cavity once from the end of the thread, and leave that other time until you have completed it.

Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	 This is the account of Gaul
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment. Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	 But the judgment of treating wounds is similar to that of other wounds.
